venue.name: Boston Public Library/ Rabb Lecture Hall

item.description:
Calling all you history buffs ...

Dr. Martha McNamara traces the relationships between MA courthouse designs and changes in the legal profession in the late 18th and early 19th centuries. "It is a fascinating story that illustrates the interplay between courthouse design and the evolving profssionalism of early American lawyers and architects," says McNamara.

McNamara, director of the New England Arts and Architecture program at Wellesley College, presents this free lecture at the BPL on April 16 at 6:00 pm. For more information on the BSA "Exploring Design" lecture series, visit http://www.architects....
item.name: Law and architecture in Massachusetts
